title: Google Photos could soon bring its AI editing tricks to your videos
description: A new set of filters was found on Google Photos allowing users to add bit of creativity to their videos.

title: Windows 11 updates are coming to make your PC more stable
description: Microsoft shipped out a new update for the Release Preview Channel, which features tons of improvements and fixes for Windows 11.

title: Sorry, the Ryzen 9 7950X isn't hitting 6.3GHz
description: The AMD Ryzen 9 7950X is a fast processor, but some testers online recently found it hitting 6.28GHz, which is faster than any consumer CPU on the market. Here's what's happened.

title: The FakeCalls Android banking scam is back
description: This popular Android malware is targeting South Korean victims by pretending to be their banks.

title: A much cheaper RTX 4060 GPU may be close to launch if this leaked image is true
description: Several newly leaked graphics card images surfaced online, including for a possible RTX 4060 Founders Edition.

title: Netgear unleashes first Wi-Fi 7 router – but do you really need it?
description: Netgear's RS700 has all the latest whistles and bells, for sure, but is there any point in going for Wi-Fi 7 just yet?

title: Far Cry 5 just got a PS5 and Xbox Series X upgrade, if you've got nothing else to play
description: Ubisoft has released a 60fps patch for Far Cry 5, arguably its most divisive shooter, on its fifth anniversary.

title: 5 Wordle solver tools to help you keep your streak alive
description: There are lots of resources out there to help you get better at Wordle. Here are 5 of our favorites.

title: Rural US hospitals are losing the ransomware war
description: These hospitals don't have the resources, or the right staff, to fight highly-skilled ransomware operators.

title: World Sleep Day: study links depression with bad sleep habits
description: Poor sleep and depression go hand-in-hand, it seems; we look at the numbers and explore how you can fix things.

title: Several zero days are plaguing Android devices with Samsung chips, warns Google
description: Google' Project Zero calls urgent attention to vulnerabilities in devices with the Exynos chip that can be exploited without user interaction.

title: 7 new movies and TV shows on Netflix, Prime Video, Disney Plus, and more this weekend (March 17)
description: From returning award-winning Apple TV Plus shows to new Prime Video dramas, there’s plenty to watch this weekend.

title: Microsoft just made it easier to patch this Bitlocker bypass flaw on Windows
description: Microsoft just released a script to help IT teams fix a BitLocker bypass security flaw found in the Windows Recovery Environment

title: YouTube TV tells subscribers how to cancel after huge price hike
description: YouTube TV has been given another big hike price that pushes it further into into cable TV territory – here's how to cancel.

title: Using PDFs in Microsoft Edge is about to get a whole lot better
description: The integration of Adobe Acrobat within Edge will gradually roll out to users free of charge.

title: AI generations can be copyrighted now - on one condition
description: So long as you’ve made significant changes to make it your own work, you may be able to copyright AI content.

title: Microsoft 365 for Android makes it easier than ever to find the files you're after
description: Tweaked ‘Recent’ tab in Microsoft 365 app for Android surfaces more files, more easily, but it’s not widely available yet.

title: Your Samsung phone may have a big security flaw – here's how to stay safe
description: The Samsung Galaxy S22 is one of the phones affected by the Exynos modem security flaw.

title: Is Apple finally working on a ChatGPT rival?
description: Apple is reportedly working on AI that could underpin a brand new Siri after years of battling “clunky code”.

title: IKEA just made the ultimate super-cheap Bluetooth speaker for epic showers
description: IKEA's ridiculously cheap 80-hour Bluetooth speaker lets you sing in the shower for days on end.

title: Starfield’s violence and “interactive drug use” has cost it a safe rating
description: Starfield received a massive blow before launch, thanks to a harsh rating at the hands of the Australian Government.

title: The Xbox Series X gets retro as the all-star Xbox 360 controller returns in June
description: Hyperkin’s upcoming officially licensed Xbox 360 controller is releasing in June.

title: Windows 11 hidden feature hints that Microsoft might be messing with the Start menu
description: Start menu spotted with ‘For You’ recommendations – a sign of things to come, perhaps?

title: Attack on healthcare provider exposes personal data of more than 4 million customers
description: Hackers stole names, social security numbers, and medical information, among other things.

title: The iPhone 15 Pro could cost more than its predecessor, but for a good reason
description: Thanks to a huge number of upgrades, the iPhone 15 Pro and iPhone 15 Pro Max could cost more than the current models.

title: Amazon’s Project Kuiper satellites kit and broadband speeds revealed
description: The prices are yet to be revealed.

title: Gov commit $100m to Help UK develop open mobile networks
description: The competition seeks to address three primary obstacles that hinder open mobile network adoption.

title: Three months free broadband offered by Virgin Media Business UK
description: Different service level agreements to choose from.

title: Shazam! Fury of the Gods director reveals the 'really good' scene he didn't want to cut

description: Looking for Quordle clues? We can help. Plus get the answers to Quordle today and past solutions.

title: Duolingo's new GPT-4 AI will happily explain why your Spanish is wrong
description: Using OpenAI's latest model, the Duo tutor can help you with learning a new language via roleplaying a real-world scenario.

title: Shazam! Fury of the Gods' big cameo wasn't a shock last-minute inclusion
description: Shazam! Fury of the Gods director David F Sandberg exclusively reveals how that big cameo came to be.
